3.3.25  7:37 am   have u tried listening to indian artists or sufi folk songs im not sure if u will like it  tho

      it's always better when i don't read the genre label. i can't tell the differnce anyway

3.3.25  6:30 am   I am a novice bass player. Other than consistent practice, what is a key tip that you think helped in your understanding of playing the bass guitar? (4 string, 5 string, etc)

      99% of the purpose of the bass is at times where the full range of instruments is playing. therefore, your entire understanding of how the bass works is gonna come from moments where you are playing in a group, (or playing along with a recording with the bass freq's muted on the recording so you get to provide them with your playing). so that's where you wanna spend your time, that's where it all takes place

3.3.25  6:05 am   if you are the president of the universe what would you do

      first thing would be figure out what a universe is

3.3.25  5:40 am   i am floating. i do not know how this happened. any tips?

      i don't know either

3.3.25  5:19 am   how do i make music

      the whole essence of music is that moment where everyone realizes that no one has any idea how or why it's working. Like a magic trick: "how did you do that???"

3.3.25  4:45 am   were you completely and utterly self taught in music? i just can't fathom having your level of talent, was it just a method of "play around and find what works" or did you have tutorials?

     i honestly feel music is about as teachable as walking

     how long did it take you to learn from scratch until your first proper song/jungle?

     i don't have anything even close to a reliable way of calculating when 'scratch' was, what 'scratch' means, when or what the first 'song' was, what 'proper' means, .... it's lifelong. also certainly true that my earliest stuff ever shown on this website was likely created AFTER already having a number of years of experience in music greater than the lifespan of many of the listeners. this is probably an indication of my insecurity more than anything else

      was there a level of obsession/crazy interest to get started, and what kept you going? apologies for all the questions - cheers.

      it's common for me to latch magnetically onto a subject, or a skill, and drill into it obsessively for many weeks continuously. But here's the thing, there was a defining moment around when i was 12 when i had a realization that goes like this: "hmmm, i'm noticing that out of all the....approx 297 of these types of obsessions i've had so far in my life, i feel like at least 211 of them have been music related". Basically it became impossible to ignore that music was the most pervasive common thread between such a high percentage of these phases, and so i knew it wasn't going away. That being said, even to this day it's still not the entire picture. and yet it still keeps delivering new crazes in new ways

3.3.25  4:23 am   my girlfriend wants to ask you if there's a reason why most music are about love. i mean i know you can argue that ALL of them are about love if you just think about it. but, i guess she wants your words, not mine. I hope you answer. she a big fan

      i guess that's where songwriters think they can envoke strong feelings

3.1.25  11:56 pm   What's the biggest lie everyone believes?

3.1.25  11:39 pm   Growing up i always wanted to create things with computers. I loved programming and art, and I made little games or websites about things I liked. I think I internalized the praise of the people around me and started making things to impress other people instead of making things to enjoy myself. I stopped putting things in my work that represented me, because I was worried that critique of the work would feel like critique of me. I would work harder on things that impressed from a technical standpoint instead of something that spoke from my heart. I strived for 'perfection,' and as a result, my 'tech art' has become significantly more 'tech' than 'art'. I feel like I can no longer express myself. Any creative thing I can think of doing reminds me of all the stuff I did when I was in middle school, and I shudder at those memories which I have now deemed 'cringe.' I feel like the most important part of my artist brain has frozen over, and I'm worried I'll never be able to thaw it. Help???

      you're gonna need to get yourself feeling a little more comfortable. have you considered taking a bubble bath? please replace the phrase 'bubble bath' with something you enjoy as much as a bubble bath enjoyer would enjoy a bubble bath per se

3.1.25  11:33 pm   the other day i went to the dollar store. i looked at the coloring books, and found one that was different from all the others. it seemed old and the pages were yellow around the edges. i looked at the back of the book and it was apparently made in 2006. but the dollar store i went to wasn't even open in 2006. it opened this year. i have no idea how that coloring book got there.

      perhaps a child left it in there. maybe they had inherited it from their parents, then was playing with it in the store, left it somewhere, looked like a product, staff restored it to the coloring book section

3.1.25  11:24 pm   what did you play in middle school band

      perc, but to be fair i played middle school band in elementery school. having realized my mistake, i quit just as my peers were starting

3.1.25  9:48 pm   What genre of music do you make?

      remind me again what my choices are

3.1.25  9:40 pm   Favorite Weezer moment?

      "... i'm just a no-class beat down FOOL, and i will always be that WAY", when i first heard that it felt like the coolest anti-rhyme. but then years later i noticed that it's actually part of a much more fastidious rhyming effort, which immediately ruined it for me. so for me the best moment was before having realized this; back when i thought it was one of the smoothest coolest casual anti-rhymes i've ever heard

3.1.25  9:25 pm   How can I be more like you? How can I live more off the wall like you; make life more colorful; more... More... 3-dimensional?

      you're gonna have to invent your own way. but that takes a long time, so in the mean time maybe you can dress like me or something, if it makes you feel more comfortable for now. maybe dress like some of your other influences next week, get a rotation going. eventually you'll cave in and just mix to your own tastes

3.1.25  9:06 pm   do you like ambiguous questions, like this one?

      that's not an ambiguous question, that's a sneak trick assumption. you tried to trick me into assuming it's an ambiguous question
